info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 05 at 3:21PM CDT until May 05 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN RUSK...NORTHWESTERN NACOGDOCHES AND NORTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 320 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over New Salem, or 16 miles southwest of Henderson, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Henderson, Ponta, Sacul, New Salem, Minden, New Summerfield, Cushing, Mount Enterprise, Reklaw, Chapman, Concord, Glenfawn, Brachfield and Laneville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for eastern and northeastern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
